pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:5.1: 58. The training rule on holding a staff
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding a staff. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:7.2: “‘I will not give teachings to anyone holding a staff who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:8.3: What is longer than that is not a staff, nor what is shorter.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:9.1: One should not give teachings to anyone holding a staff who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:9.2: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings to someone holding a staff who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:10.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:10.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:11.1: The eighth training rule is finished.
